context: [2] Its distribution has been shown to follow the expected patternâ€”that is, areas of the United Kingdom with high NO2 concentrations correlate well with the geographical distribution of the major urban conurbations and major emission sources. [3] Discussion will focus on NO2 in this section.  [1] NO2 is of concern to human health as it is soluble and can be absorbed by the mucous lining of the nasopharyngeal cavity, where it is converted to nitrous and nitric acids.  [2] The oxidant properties of NO2 after acute exposure at levels of 5000â€“10 000 ppb can cause respiratory illness, such as pharyngeal irritation, cough, and dyspnoea.  [3] Resistance to respiratory infection can also be impaired by NO2 exposure below 500 ppb.  [4] NO2 levels in urban environments are usually below 150 ppb.  [5] The UK National Air Quality standard for NO2 is 150 ppb, measured as an hourly mean.
